channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023080308
item.description:
Report E-2023080308

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading at the facility it was noticed that the floor around the tote was wet. They immediately put down absorbent material to collect the material. Tote was removed from truck and our inhouse response team arrived to transfer the material to a new tote. It was discovered that a small pinhole was in the top of the tote and the material would seep out. There was less than 0.5 gallons released and was all contained in truck no material made it out of the vehicle. The cleanup process was completed while wearing the proper PPE and all material was packaged and processed in the proper manner.

item.title: Report X-2023080550
item.description:
Report X-2023080550

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080550 SequenceEvent: Package was found in unload leakage damage visible on the outside of the box. DescribePack: 1 Jug leaked from the cap, no damage to the jug itself DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was retrieved and placed in lined hazmat tote. It was then removed to the hazmat cage. 2. X-2023080553 SequenceEvent: package was found leaking in the unload, it was placed in a lined hazmat tote and removed to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 bottle found leaking around the cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080528
item.description:
Report X-2023080528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Brought over to QA area damaged and left unattended. A certified Admin took proper procedures upon discovery of damaged product. DescribePack: Appears to have a pinhole near the outer rim of the paint can causing it to leak out. DurationRel: 27 and MitigateEffect: certified admin put gloves on to handle the product that was damaged before placing into a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080271
item.description:
Report X-2023080271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler discovered package when putting away tugger and brought to QA attention and QA got right to work. DescribePack: the package was discovered on its side with what looks like was pushed off IC belt which is probably what caused cap to come loose and leak contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed upright in hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080263
item.description:
Report X-2023080263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the hazmat cage, it had been dropped and the lid and upper part of the pail had been dented and crushed. Leakage was evident at the seal between the lid and the pail. Pail was placed in a Hazmat tote with a lid. DescribePack: dented and crushed at the top of the container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The immediate area was evacuated and the container was moved to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023071236
item.description:
Report X-2023071236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE AND SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVING, RESPONDER NOTICED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID PACKAGE LEAKING AS WELL. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL. PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED MATERIAL WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023080051
item.description:
Report E-2023080051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit on I-70 eastbound in St. Louis, MO the XPO truck/trailer was involved in a rollover accident which damaged nine of the metal 55 gallon drums of 2-pentanone(un1993) but only releasing 0.5 quart from a damaged bung. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
